prompt.stem: A circuit is set up as shown. The capacitor is initially uncharged. Switch S is now closed and the capacitor charges. The graph shows how the charging current I in the circuit varies with time t. The capacitor is now replaced with an uncharged capacitor of greater capacitance. The same charging process is repeated with this capacitor. Which graph shows how the current I varies with time t as this capacitor charges?

assets.alt: charging circuit and current–time graph with options

level1: Recall how capacitance affects the time constant τ in an RC circuit.
level2: For the same resistor and supply, initial current is the same but the decay is slower when C is larger (larger τ).

level3.content: At t=0, the capacitor is uncharged and behaves like a short; I0 depends on V and R, not C.
τ = RC increases when C increases, so current decays more slowly.
Choose the graph with the same initial current but a slower exponential decay (option C).

common_errors: Thinking a larger capacitance increases initial current
Thinking current reaches zero faster with larger capacitance
